parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
